TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit TripleDES extends System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm

Docs.summary: Represents the base class for Triple Data Encryption Standard algorithms from which all TripleDES implementations must derive.

remarks.format:
## Remarks TripleDES uses three successive iterations of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.DES> algorithm. It can use either two or three 56-bit keys.
> [!NOTE] > A newer symmetric encryption algorithm, Advanced Encryption Standard (AES), is available. Consider using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Aes> class and its derived classes instead of the TripleDES class. Use TripleDES only for compatibility with legacy applications and data.
This algorithm supports key lengths from 128 bits to 192 bits in increments of 64 bits.
## Examples The following code example method uses <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCryptoServiceProvider> with the specified key (<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm.Key%2A>) and initialization vector (<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm.IV%2A>) to encrypt a file specified by `inName`. It then outputs the encrypted result to the file specified by `outName`.
[!code-cpp[Classic TripleDESCryptoServiceProvider Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.crypto_61_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Classic TripleDESCryptoServiceProvider Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.crypto_61_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic TripleDESCryptoServiceProvider Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.crypto_61_1.vb)]
Decryption can be handled in the same way; use <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCryptoServiceProvider.CreateDecryptor%2A> instead of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCryptoServiceProvider.CreateEncryptor%2A>. The same key (<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm.Key%2A>) and initialization vector (<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm.IV%2A>) used to encrypt the file must be used to decrypt it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You cannot create an instance of an abstract class. Application code will create a new instance of a derived class.
This method initializes the protected fields of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm> class to the default values listed in the following table.
|Field|Default Value| |-----------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm.KeySizeValue>|192| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm.BlockSizeValue>|64| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm.FeedbackSizeValue>|64|

Docs.summary: Creates an instance of a cryptographic object to perform the algorithm.
Docs.returns: An instance of a cryptographic object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Creates a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDES> class.
## Examples The following code example shows how to create and use a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDES> object to encrypt and decrypt data in a file.
[!code-cs[Cryptography.3DES.Create.File#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.crypto_61_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[Cryptography.3DES.Create.File#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.crypto_61_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.3DES.Create.File#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.crypto_61_1.vb)]
The following code example shows how to create and use a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDES> object to encrypt and decrypt data in memory.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsWeakKey(unsigned int8[] rgbKey) cil managed

Docs.param: The secret key to test for weakness.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified key is weak.
Docs.returns: if the key is weak; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Weak keys are keys that result in ciphers that are easy to break. If text is encrypted with a weak key, encrypting the resulting cipher again with the same weak key returns the original text. In 128-bit mode, if the first 64 bits are the same as the last 64 bits, the key is weak. In 192-bit mode, if the first 64 bits are the same as the second 64 bits or if the second 64 bits are the same as the last 64 bits, the key is weak.
Attempting to set a weak key results in a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException>. When <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCryptoServiceProvider.GenerateKey%2A> is called to create a random key, a weak key will never be returned.

Docs.exception: The size of the parameter is not valid.

Docs.exception: An attempt was made to set the key to .

An attempt was made to set a key whose length is invalid.
-or-
An attempt was made to set a weak key (see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDES.IsWeakKey%2A>).
